intro: Chamaesciadium caucalioides, commonly known as the Caucasian chamaesciadium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant features compound leaves with a fern-like appearance and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, growing at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
